conclusion: Analyzing the problem to find the ratio of loop currents and the ratio of powers of the external forces.
A metal rod slides along horizontal rails from position ab to position a'b'.
The rod has resistance R and the rails have negligible resistance.
The rod moves at speed v₁ in one case and v₂ in another, with v₁:v₂ = 1:2.
The crossed (×) symbols indicate a uniform magnetic field pointing into the page.
Induced EMF is calculated using EMF = BLv for speeds v₁ and v₂: EMF₁ = BLv₁, EMF₂ = BLv₂.
Current is calculated using I = EMF/R: I₁ = BLv₁/R, I₂ = BLv₂/R.
Ratio of currents is I₁/I₂ = v₁/v₂ = 1/2.
Power of external forces is calculated using P = Fv = BILv: P₁ = B²L²v₁²/R, P₂ = B²L²v₂²/R.
Ratio of powers is P₁/P₂ = v₁²/v₂² = 1/4.
Final answer: Ratio of loop currents is 1:2 and ratio of powers of the external forces is 1:4.
Current ratio is proportional to the velocity ratio, while the power ratio is proportional to the square of the velocity ratio.
